entries.body: All ##Windows Phone 8 CSS3 support (IE Mobile) #### Windows Phone 8 renders with IE7 standards by default with POP3/IMAP accounts ```html ``` Note: Exchange ActiveSync based accounts do not benefit from forcing the document mode because the rendering engine is not IE Mobile. For more information see http://blog.jmwhite.co.uk/2014/08/19/email-campaigns-windows-phone-part-2-pop3-and-imap/ -courtesy of zerocents and James White ##Kill Gmail App Zooming: #### Stop Gmail app from zooming text ```html style="min-width:600px;" ``` -courtesy of Chris Wise ##Target Webkit Clients: #### Webkit's support is best support ```css @media screen and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio:0) { } ``` -courtesy of Kevin Mandeville ##Remove autolink styling in iOS: #### Fix automatic styling of phone numbers, etc. Use a span: ```css .appleLinksBlack a { text-decoration:none !important; } .appleLinksBlack a { color:#000000 !important; } ``` ```html 866-787-7030 ``` Add additional classes such as `.appleLinksWhite a`, `.appleLinksPink a` when appropriate -courtesy of Justine Jordan ##Outlook “View in Browser”: #### Forces Outlook to provide a “view in browser link” ```css #outlook a { padding: 0; } ``` ##Fix mailto in Outlook.com #### Outlook.com stops mailto from opening a new message Add "target=_blank" ```html Link ``` -courtesy of Matthijs ##Ghost column to emulate "align" in Outlook #### Outlook hates "align"; we love conditionals ```html Table X Table Y ``` -courtesy of Mike Ragan http://labs.actionrocket.co/make_mobile_email_work_in_outlook ##Margins and Float in Outlook: #### Use a capital “M” or “F” ```html style="Margin: 20px; Float: left" ``` -courtesy of Nicole Merlin ##Interactive Email con’t - Hover!: #### Hover effect works on these clients: Gmail: ```css * [lang~="x-selector"]:hover { } ``` Outlook Web: ```css .class:hover ``` Yahoo! Web: ```css .class:hover ``` -courtesy of Justin at FreshInbox ##Interactive Email in Gmail: #### No Class or ID selector support Use lang as selector with "x-" prefix ```css * [lang~="x-selector"] { } ``` ```html ``` -courtesy of Justin at FreshInbox ##Images in Outlook 2013: #### Fix broken images in Outlook 2013 ```html ``` ##Image gaps in Office 365 (OWA) #### Office 365 strips display:block causing images to have massive gaps Wrapping an image in a ` ` with a height equal to the image height will simulate a block element for clients that won't accept `display:block`. ```html ``` In some cases the addition of `font-size:0;` may be required in order to remove further gaps created by certain CSS properties set on the parent element i.e. table cell such as line-height. Warning: Small font sizes can effect your spam score. For more information visit: http://www.emailonacid.com/blog/details/C13/two_fixes_for_image_spacing_in_outlook_web_app_owa -courtesy of James White at http://blog.jmwhite.co.uk ##Hide content in Office 365/OWA (incl Webmail): #### Office 365 strips display, mso-hide, mso conditional Set font-size in containing cell to “0px” ```html ``` ##Fix mailto in gmail #### gmail strips subject and body from mailto links Use lowercase for subject anbd body attribute ```html email@email.com ``` -courtesy of SV ##Stop some clients from stripping class: #### Some clients strip any lines starting with “.” Use a space before any class styling ```css .selector { } ``` -courtesy of Campaign Monitor http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/ways-to-build/using-css-in-campaigns ##Click To Tap: #### Change button text responsively ```css @media screen and (max-width:600px) { span[class=click] {display: none !important; max-height: 0 !important;} span[class=tap]:after {content:”Tap”;} ``` ```html Click here ``` -courtesy of Nicole Merlin ##Good formatting for bulleted list: #### Stops bullet from sitting between two lines ```html • Prolongs oil life ``` -courtesy of Michelle Klann
